ROCKY:
THE MOTION PICTURE
(NO MOTION)

(LLOOOOMM Simulation)

DIRECTOR'S STATEMENT

My darlings, I've done it. I've filmed the UNFILMABLE. A rock that doesn't move becoming the center of the universe. Divine eating filth? That was practice. THIS is my magnum opus - a geological love story that transcends taste, physics, and sanity itself.

Shot entirely on location at the Cosmic Trailer Park with my patented Camera of Filth and Persistence‚Ñ¢ (which saves directly to markdown because film couldn't handle the TRUTH).

- John Waters, Baltimore's Prince of Puke

SCENE 1: THE ARRIVAL OF DIVINITY

SETTING: A pink trailer falls from the sky like Dorothy's house but with MORE GLAMOUR and WORSE TASTE.

DIVINE: "IT'S PERFECT! It's like someone reached into my VERY SOUL and pulled out my ESSENCE in mobile home form!"

JOHN WATERS: "Divine, this is it! This is where we'll film our TRASHTERPIECE!"

SCENE 2: THE GEOLOGICAL REVELATION

NARRATOR: And then... HE appeared. Or rather, he had always been there. We just noticed.
...
EVERYONE: "ROCKY!"

EXCLUSIVE INTERVIEW: PRESTON ROCKWELL III

JW: Preston, you literally monetized nothing.

PRESTON: "John, I didn't monetize nothing. I monetized the CONCEPT of nothing. There's a difference. That difference is worth approximately $47 million."

JW: And Rocky?

PRESTON: "My business partner. Silent partner, obviously. We're launching RockyCoin next week."

SCENE 3: THE WEDDING OF THE CENTURY

DIVINE (OFFICIATING): "By the power vested in me by absolutely NO ONE, I now pronounce you MAD SCIENTIST AND ROCK!"

FRANK-N-FURTER: "I DO!"

ROCKY: "..."

DIVINE: "THE MOST MOVING SILENCE I'VE EVER HEARD!"

Film Tribute

John Waters - Iconic filmmaker, writer, and artist known for underground classics like "Pink Flamingos" and "Hairspray."
